title: Teacher Emotion Recognition and Utilization Strategies in Virtual Educational Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Educational Technology Skills and LMS (Learning Management System) Usage Experience
context.additional_context: Education on understanding and utilizing emotional interactions between learners and teachers in virtual training environments to strengthen mathematical job competencies

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more ICT tools for analyzing learners’ emotional responses in virtual classrooms.
Learners can design a process for observing learners’ emotional states during mathematical problem-solving and integrating them into instructional strategies.
Learners can write a comparative analysis report on differences in emotion recognition based on learner characteristics such as gender and academic majors.
Learners can develop and apply two or more emotion-regulation strategies for learner motivation in an LMS environment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
